snippet.textDisplay: I honestly enjoyed the game, my gripes are more with the story, Wild Area and lack of creative routes. Like the routes are beautiful at times but not super challenging. The Story felt very secondary to the "Complete the Gym Challenge" A Plot where in past games there was a nice mix of the A and B plot lines whereas here it was like Leons gets to do all the cool stuff cause Ive gotta complete my challenge. The Wild Area while vast and a fresh idea was tackled well. Yeah theres a dip in quality there but most of the time Im not paying attention to the trees or blades of grass. I love pokemon and dont hate this game, but its got its issues, but as an experience I really loved it.
snippet.textOriginal: I honestly enjoyed the game, my gripes are more with the story, Wild Area and lack of creative routes. Like the routes are beautiful at times but not super challenging. The Story felt very secondary to the "Complete the Gym Challenge" A Plot where in past games there was a nice mix of the A and B plot lines whereas here it was like Leons gets to do all the cool stuff cause Ive gotta complete my challenge. The Wild Area while vast and a fresh idea was tackled well. Yeah theres a dip in quality there but most of the time Im not paying attention to the trees or blades of grass. I love pokemon and dont hate this game, but its got its issues, but as an experience I really loved it.

snippet.authorDisplayName: Just another brick in the machine
snippet.textDisplay:
I have to say, i'm dissapointed that the channel is getting away from being a quirky type of "review" channel from the perspective of someone who isn't that familiar with video games to just being straight up a very verbose and opinionated actual review channel. I can go everywhere if i want a funny video game review or a hit piece on why Pokemon has been stale and how sword and shield only compounds every problem of the series. I can't, however, go anywhere to see a review for what it is like to live with someone that plays Pokemon Sw&Sh.
Also the fact that you, who has been previously characterized as this aloof third party in the experience just having some fun with being an observer at the cost of context as to how it is to actually play the video game, suddenly turning on her heels and explaining in detail what makes a specific game good or bad just feels massively disingenuous. It''s like your boyfriend hated the game so much he felt the need to shove in a paragraph about how much it sucks.
Maybe i'm just being dramatic or overreacting, this video isn't even that bad, i have to admit that some parts did make me chuckle; but it feels to much like it was written just like a normal review and i don't want this channel to slowly become just another slighlty humerous video game critic channel when it started out with a pretty unique and funny premise.
snippet.textOriginal:
I have to say, i'm dissapointed that the channel is getting away from being a quirky type of "review" channel  from the perspective of someone who isn't that familiar with video games to just being straight up a very verbose and opinionated actual review channel. I can go everywhere if i want a funny video game review or a hit piece on why Pokemon has been stale and how sword and shield only compounds every problem of the series. I can't, however,  go anywhere to see a review for what it is like to live with someone that plays Pokemon Sw&Sh.
Also the fact that you, who has been previously characterized as this aloof third party in the experience just having some fun with being an observer at the cost of context as to how it is to actually play the video game, suddenly turning on her heels and explaining in detail what makes a specific game good or bad just feels  massively disingenuous. It''s like your boyfriend hated the game so much he felt the need to shove in a paragraph about how much it sucks.
Maybe i'm just being dramatic or overreacting, this video isn't even that bad, i have to admit that some parts did make me chuckle; but it feels to much like it was written just like a normal review and i don't want this channel to slowly become just another slighlty humerous video game critic channel when it started out with a pretty unique and funny premise.

snippet.textDisplay:
To anyone feeling burned by Gen 8, please try Dragon Quest 11 S

It has more charm than any pokemon game, and is a technical marvel on the switch. Story is fantastic, battling is turn based but deeper than Pokemon, the monsters are expressive and full of life, and its just overall a game that was made with love and it shows. I really cannot recommend this game enough, especially if you enjoy pokemon.
snippet.textOriginal:
To anyone feeling burned by Gen 8, please try Dragon Quest 11 S

It has more charm than any pokemon game, and is a technical marvel on the switch. Story is fantastic, battling is turn based but deeper than Pokemon, the monsters are expressive and full of life, and its just overall a game that was made with love and it shows. I really cannot recommend this game enough, especially if you enjoy pokemon.

snippet.textDisplay:
Because of subreddits that are just echo chambers of hype-praise and me losing interest in Pokémon around the DS era, I actually thought with every "new" iteration that I just wasn't "getting it". Let's try the demo I says and see what's new. The same child venturing out on a journey with a completely missed opportunity for a coming of age story progression. The same childish dialog. The same turn based battles that haven't changed, implemented rhythm based combat or new strategies.

In 1998 unboxing a Red Pokemon cartridge and playing a game that seemed so large was exciting, I didn't even watch the cartoon, I was in it purely for those pixelated pets - but over 2 decades later the game seems smaller than ever. Just vote with your wallet and know that the game you thought would happen in 2019 can be found elsewhere.
snippet.textOriginal:
Because of subreddits that are just echo chambers of hype-praise and me losing interest in Pokémon around the DS era, I actually thought with every "new" iteration that I just wasn't "getting it".  Let's try the demo I says and see what's new.  The same child venturing out on a journey with a completely missed opportunity for a coming of age story progression.  The same childish dialog.  The same turn based battles that haven't changed, implemented rhythm based combat or new strategies.

In 1998 unboxing a Red Pokemon cartridge and playing a game that seemed so large was exciting, I didn't even watch the cartoon, I was in it purely for those pixelated pets - but over 2 decades later the game seems smaller than ever.  Just vote with your wallet and know that the game you thought would happen in 2019 can be found elsewhere.

snippet.textDisplay:
Yet another great review--you guys never fail to make me laugh! I also have really enjoyed the things you bring up and the points you make about games and the industry itself in some of your recent reviews.

I think it might be fun for you to try one of the Pokemon spin off games! They have a fun twist on gameplay that I think is missing from the main series. I'm partial to the Pokemon Ranger games myself (the second is the best one) even if it's just drawing circles the video game. Mystery Dungeon is really cool too, and has a bit more in gameplay from what I've seen! You may really enjoy those if you haven't tried them already.

Thank you for the quality content as always, Shelby and Matt!! 🎉
snippet.textOriginal:
Yet another great review--you guys never fail to make me laugh! I also have really enjoyed the things you bring up and the points you make about games and the industry itself in some of your recent reviews.

I think it might be fun for you to try one of the Pokemon spin off games! They have a fun twist on gameplay that I think is missing from the main series. I'm partial to the Pokemon Ranger games myself (the second is the best one) even if it's just drawing circles the video game. Mystery Dungeon is really cool too, and has a bit more in gameplay from what I've seen! You may really enjoy those if you haven't tried them already.

Thank you for the quality content as always, Shelby and Matt!! 🎉

snippet.textDisplay: Yep after Lets go Eevee I will never buy a Pokemon game again and not because it is the pinnacle but yeah everything GFR said. It is not a good game and I don't think it ever was. When I can dust off my Gameboy color, totally got the neon purple one too, pop in Pokemon blue and have nothing in the core game loop change... it makes me sad. As an aspiring game developer, with a day job, I find it ridiculous that The Pokemon Company has not changed anything in the core game loop in over 2 decades and still rakes in so much money. Why do I even bother trying to make games that are trying new things when the consumers out there will drop all their money on the same re-skinned game from the 90's. I might as well just make a re-skinned Clash of Clans, Boom Beach, or Clash Royal and survive off the micro-transactions.
snippet.textOriginal: Yep after Lets go Eevee I will never buy a Pokemon game again and not because it is the pinnacle but yeah everything GFR said. It is not a good game and I don't think it ever was. When I can dust off my Gameboy color, totally got the neon purple one too, pop in Pokemon blue and have nothing in the core game loop change... it makes me sad. As an aspiring game developer, with a day job, I find it ridiculous that The Pokemon Company has not changed anything in the core game loop in over 2 decades and still rakes in so much money. Why do I even bother trying to make games that are trying new things when the consumers out there will drop all their money on the same re-skinned game from the 90's. I might as well just make a re-skinned Clash of Clans, Boom Beach, or Clash Royal and survive off the micro-transactions.

snippet.textDisplay: I'm not in agreement with this review mostly because there is a large amount postgame to play. I've got over 300 hours logged already but over 200 of those aren't from the story. They are due to team building, shiny hunting, and battling in the online ranked singles and doubles. For me this review was like watching someone review Call of Duty without touching the multiplayer. And the pokemon company has made it clear that they want multiplayer to become a more significant part of the gameplay. In my opinion, they have made big progress in that direction. This review doesn't even mention any of that.
snippet.textOriginal: I'm not in agreement with this review mostly because there is a large amount postgame to play. I've got over 300 hours logged already but over 200 of those aren't from the story. They are due to team building, shiny hunting, and battling in the online ranked singles and doubles. For me this review was like watching someone review Call of Duty without touching the multiplayer. And the pokemon company has made it clear that they want multiplayer to become a more significant part of the gameplay. In my opinion, they have made big progress in that direction. snippet.textDisplay: Amazing videos, but could you please put a very short—between 3 and 10 seconds—static intro at the beginning of every video? On mobile especially, it takes away from the enjoyment that you have important visuals and narration from the very first second when I’m often maximizing the video and rotating my phone. Don’t go crazy, of course, as too many channels spend the first 20-30 seconds wasting everyone’s time and begging to be skipped. Thanks for the consideration.

snippet.textDisplay: So I also played the gen one games and have fond memories of Pokémon. That being said I totally agree with you on the look of the game especially when you compare it to say Zelda. I myself do like the RPG gameplay but I’m also an old school Final Fantasy guy so that could be why I like the format of the game. The story though is the same old recycled one every year except it gets cornier and dumber every year. I get it they are trying to appeal to kids but kids aren’t their only audience. Since they always put out two games I’d like to see one be geared more towards the adults. One with a better compelling story more challenging gameplay and maybe even an option for traditional turn based fighting or something modern. All and all it’s the same Pokémon from when I was a kid it just got a graphics upgrade.
snippet.textOriginal: So I also played the gen one games and have fond memories of Pokémon. That being said I totally agree with you on the look of the game especially when you compare it to say Zelda. I myself do like the RPG gameplay but I’m also an old school Final Fantasy guy so that could be why I like the format of the game. The story though is the same old recycled one every year except it gets cornier and dumber every year. I get it they are trying to appeal to kids but kids aren’t their only audience. Since they always put out two games I’d like to see one be geared more towards the adults. One with a better compelling story more challenging gameplay and maybe even an option for traditional turn based fighting or something modern. All and all it’s the same Pokémon from when I was a kid it just got a graphics upgrade.

snippet.textDisplay: The one critique I have of the game is the route/town design. They are all so linear and you have nothing to do in any town. Despite being beautiful (I really don't get how you can call anything but the wild area ugly), there's nothing but the main story to do. The champion/rival are some of the best of the series, and the music is phenomenal while the core gameplay really doesn't need to be changed. It received QOL changes and an interesting Dynamax mechanic which combines zmoves and megas together into a fair and balanced mechanic. Now you actually have to think about when to Dynamax n such. The wild area is so much fun and I spent the first 10 hours of my playthrough just exploring it, and I wish there was more to do, but merely having Pokemon in the overworld who chase you, run away from you, greet you, and just do different things, was an experience I have never had in a Pokemon game before. It truly felt like I was in the anime exploring, camping, cooking, and catching Pokemon like Ash and his friends do. Game Freak really just needs more time to polish it, because it already is good enough, but with more time it can turn into something special.
snippet.textOriginal: The one critique I have of the game is the route/town design. They are all so linear and you have nothing to do in any town. Despite being beautiful (I really don't get how you can call anything but the wild area ugly), there's nothing but the main story to do. The champion/rival are some of the best of the series, and the music is phenomenal while the core gameplay really doesn't need to be changed. It received QOL changes and an interesting Dynamax mechanic which combines zmoves and megas together into a fair and balanced mechanic. Now you actually have to think about when to Dynamax n such. The wild area is so much fun and I spent the first 10 hours of my playthrough just exploring it, and I wish there was more to do, but merely having Pokemon in the overworld who chase you, run away from you, greet you, and just do different things, was an experience I have never had in a Pokemon game before. It truly felt like I was in the anime exploring, camping, cooking, and catching Pokemon like Ash and his friends do. Game Freak really just needs more time to polish it, because it already is good enough, but with more time it can turn into something special.

snippet.textDisplay: how do we stop this repetitive cycle and get Game Freak to get off their bum and actually make a good game? I got it. Competition. Im willing to bet that if a game comes out with the same premise that improves upon where Sword and Shield failed then we'll have a good competitor to Pokemon. And once Game Freak see's that they can no longer release the same thing over and over with all this competition then theyll actually do something to not lose their fan base and remain relevant.
snippet.textOriginal: how do we stop this repetitive cycle and get Game Freak to get off their bum and actually make a good game? I got it. Competition. Im willing to bet that if a game comes out with the same premise that improves upon where Sword and Shield failed then we'll have a good competitor to Pokemon. And once Game Freak see's that they can no longer release the same thing over and over with all this competition then theyll actually do something to not lose their fan base and remain relevant.

snippet.textDisplay: This video was totally right in so many areas. The games are definitely lower quality than they should be for the amount of money the series makes. But for me personally, I play competitive Pokemon and they’ve done a good job making it really fun to make teams and battle others. If I just got the game for the story and stopped playing there I likely would be disappointed. But I’ve played three times as long as it took to finish the story just training and battling so I believe I got my money’s worth. Hopefully the next game delivers something extra.
snippet.textOriginal: This video was totally right in so many areas. The games are definitely lower quality than they should be for the amount of money the series makes. But for me personally, I play competitive Pokemon and they’ve done a good job making it really fun to make teams and battle others. If I just got the game for the story and stopped playing there I likely would be disappointed. But I’ve played three times as long as it took to finish the story just training and battling so I believe I got my money’s worth. Hopefully the next game delivers something extra.

snippet.textDisplay: 😅 I don't think after playing Let's go Eevee that you've actually experienced "Gen 1" as such, and you really can't compare it as a gen 1 title to Sword and Shield and say "they haven't progressed at all" because LGP&E are nothing like red, blue or yellow. These games have come on leaps and bounds within the parameters of what the game actually is and it's not trying to be anything else. Pokemon inherently will never have the dynamic feel of games like BOTW regardless of what platform you play them on, but I like that because it's relaxing and not frustrating as hell for less experienced gamers like me. It has never been like that either in the main line of games, so I think it would be unfaithful to make it like that now. Not all games have to follow the same recipe and I'm glad that games like Pokemon exist.
snippet.textOriginal: 😅 I don't think after playing Let's go Eevee that you've actually experienced "Gen 1" as such, and you really can't compare it as a gen 1 title to Sword and Shield and say "they haven't progressed at all" because LGP&E are nothing like red, blue or yellow. These games have come on leaps and bounds within the parameters of what the game actually is and it's not trying to be anything else. Pokemon inherently will never have the dynamic feel of games like BOTW regardless of what platform you play them on, but I like that because it's relaxing and not frustrating as hell for less experienced gamers like me. It has never been like that either in the main line of games, so I think it would be unfaithful to make it like that now. Not all games have to follow the same recipe and I'm glad that games like Pokemon exist.

snippet.textDisplay:
110% agree, unfortunately I get the feeling that most media outlets get paid by companies to inflate the "popularity" of their trash tier products thus helping the sales.
.
My love for the franchise started waning during Black and White. For me, pokemon's final form was when Arceus was introduced. It was the literal god of that universe and the legendary of the legendaries, so playing through Black n White just having more of the same thing to do started to get boring. But they did not stop there, they keep adding MORE! and I really felt like puking when I saw what they did with Sun and Moon. Seriously, Z-moves and Alolan forms? They made it feel like some super sentai game. Instead of improving on all the previous pokemons stats and balances, they keep adding more like this is some mobile gacha game. And now they cut on content because there is just too many? What a joke.
snippet.textOriginal:
110% agree, unfortunately I get the feeling that most media outlets get paid by companies to inflate the "popularity" of their trash tier products thus helping the sales.
.
My love for the franchise started waning during Black and White. For me, pokemon's final form was when Arceus was introduced. It was the literal god of that universe and the legendary of the legendaries, so playing through Black n White just having more of the same thing to do started to get boring. But they did not stop there, they keep adding MORE! and I really felt like puking when I saw what they did with Sun and Moon. Seriously, Z-moves and Alolan forms? They made it feel like some super sentai game. Instead of improving on all the previous pokemons stats and balances, they keep adding more like this is some mobile gacha game. And now they cut on content because there is just too many? What a joke.

Only thing this franchise is good for is WAIFUS and race wars.
